author: La rÃ©daction
title: La production de Boeing en partie paralysÃ©e par sa premiÃ¨re grÃ¨ve inÃ©dite depuis 2008 - Nice-Matin
text:
L'arrÃªt de travail a dÃ©butÃ© aprÃ¨s le rejet massif du projet de nouvelle convention collective , nÃ©gociÃ© depuis mars par Boeing et l'antenne locale du syndicat des machinistes (IAM) et qui devait succÃ©der Ã  celle datant de 2008 qui expirait jeudi Ã  minuit.
Les plus de 33.000 syndiquÃ©s de l'avionneur dans la rÃ©gion de Seattle - sur quelque 170.000 employÃ©s du groupe - ont rejetÃ© l'accord annoncÃ© le 8 septembre Ã  94,6% et approuvÃ© un dÃ©brayage Ã  96% , selon Jon Holden, prÃ©sident de l'IAM-District 751.
Il a Ã©galement annoncÃ© un recours contre Boeing auprÃ¨s de l'agence fÃ©dÃ©rale chargÃ©e du droit du travail (NRLB) pour pratiques dÃ©loyales pendant les nÃ©gociations.
La derniÃ¨re grÃ¨ve, en 2008, avait durÃ© 57 jours.
Face au mÃ©contentement des adhÃ©rents, M. Holden avait toutefois affirmÃ© ne pouvoir "garantir que nous obtiendrons davantage en faisant grÃ¨ve".
Ce dÃ©brayage paralyse les deux grandes usines d'assemblage de Renton et d'Everett, qui produisent le best-seller 737 MAX, le 777 et le 767 (version cargo et ravitailleur militaire), dont les livraisons cumulent dÃ©jÃ  les retards.
La production d'autres sites, notamment une usine de piÃ¨ces dÃ©tachÃ©es Ã  Portland (Oregon) tout proche, est Ã©galement arrÃªtÃ©e, tout comme le rÃ©usinage de dizaines de 787 Dreamliner effectuÃ© Ã  Everett depuis plusieurs mois.
En revanche, l'assemblage du Dreamliner n'est pas perturbÃ©e Ã  ce stade car l'usine se trouve en Caroline du Sud (est) et n'est pas concernÃ©e par cette convention collective.
"Chancelant" Un Boeing 777 en cours d'assemblage Ã  l'usine d'Everett (nord-ouest), le 26 juin 2024. Photo AFP. L'avionneur encaisse la plus grosse partie du paiement (environ 60%) Ã  la remise des avions. Il peut livrer ceux ayant reÃ§u le feu vert du rÃ©gulateur FAA avant la grÃ¨ve mais son rythme de production fonctionne au ralenti depuis un incident en vol dÃ©but janvier sur un 737 MAX 9 d'Alaska Airlines.
"Pour un Boeing financiÃ¨rement chancelant, une grÃ¨ve est la derniÃ¨re chose dont il avait besoin" , selon Leeham News, site spÃ©cialisÃ© dans l'aviation.
D'aprÃ¨s les analystes de TD Cowen, une grÃ¨ve de 50 jours priverait Boeing de 3 Ã  3,5 milliards de dollars de liquiditÃ©s et aurait un impact de 5,5 milliards sur le chiffre d'affaires.
"La grÃ¨ve va affecter la production, les livraisons et les activitÃ©s, et elle va menacer notre reprise", a affirmÃ© vendredi matin Brian West, directeur financier de Boeing, lors d'une confÃ©rence organisÃ©e par une banque.
"La grÃ¨ve injecte tellement d'incertitudes" qu'il s'est refusÃ© Ã  toute prÃ©vision pour 2024 et 2025, assurant que la prioritÃ© Ã©tait de "prÃ©server nos liquiditÃ©s".
"Le message selon lequel l'accord de principe conclu avec les dirigeants de l'IAM n'est pas acceptable pour ses membres est clair", avait rÃ©agi Boeing, se disant " prÃªts Ã  retourner Ã  la table des nÃ©gociations pour parvenir Ã  un nouvel accord".
Une semaine aprÃ¨s sa prise de fonction le 8 aoÃ»t, le nouveau patron de l'avionneur Kelly Ortberg s'Ã©tait engagÃ© Ã  "rÃ©initialiser" la relation avec le syndicat.
Vers 17H20 GMT, l'action Boeing chutait de 3,72% Ã  la Bourse de New York.
Les adhÃ©rents du syndicat des machinistes IAM-District 751 ont approuvÃ© la grÃ¨ve, le 12 septembre 2024 AFP / Jason Redmond. La convention collective rejetÃ©e prÃ©voyait une hausse salariale de 25% sur quatre ans, un engagement d'investissements dans la rÃ©gion, ainsi que la construction du prochain avion - annoncÃ© pour 2035 - autour de Seattle, ce qui devait assurer des emplois pour plusieurs dÃ©cennies.
Boeing espÃ©rait que ces concessions suffiraient Ã  esquiver une grÃ¨ve. Sa situation financiÃ¨re est prÃ©caire depuis le crash de deux 737 MAX 8 en 2018 et en 2019 (346 morts), et moult problÃ¨mes de qualitÃ© de la production.
"Ce n'est un secret pour personne: notre activitÃ© traverse une pÃ©riode difficile, en partie Ã  cause de nos propres erreurs du passÃ©. (...) Une grÃ¨ve mettrait en pÃ©ril notre reprise commune", prÃ©venait mercredi soir M. Ortberg, exhortant les employÃ©s Ã  ne pas "sacrifier" les progrÃ¨s futurs en raison de "frustrations liÃ©es au passÃ©".
Mais les mÃ©contents jugent la hausse salariale trop Ã©loignÃ©e des demandes du syndicat (+40% initialement) et le volet sur les retraites insatisfaisant. "On nous a bradÃ©s", a lancÃ© jeudi Ã  l'AFP Kamie Bryan, employÃ©e chez Boeing depuis 18 ans.
"Ils parlent d'une augmentation de 25%, mais ce n'est pas le cas", a dÃ©clarÃ© Paul Janousek, dÃ©nonÃ§ant une prÃ©sentation "trompeuse" par Boeing. Selon cet Ã©lectricien de 55 ans, dont treize chez l'avionneur, son augmentation n'atteindrait qu'environ 9% du fait de la suppression d'une prime annuelle.
Selon le rÃ¨glement de l'IAM, les grÃ©vistes recevront 250 dollars par semaine Ã  partir de la troisiÃ¨me semaine d'arrÃªt de travail.

author: Europa Press Sociedad
title: El Vaticano pide a budistas y cristianos practicar la "reconciliaciÃ³n y la resiliencia" para contrarrestar la violencia
text: ROMA, 6 May. (EUROPA PRESS) - El Dicasterio para el DiÃ¡logo Interreligioso ha enviado un mensaje a los budistas con motivo de la conmemoraciÃ³n del nacimiento de Buda (Vesak), en el que ha instado a budistas y cristianos a practicar la \"reconciliaciÃ³n y la resiliencia\" para combatir la \"cultura de la violencia\" de los tiempos modernos. \"Como se enseÃ±a en los rituales y cultos de nuestras respectivas tradiciones religiosas, la reconciliaciÃ³n y la resiliencia son, por tanto, correctivos necesarios a una cultura de violencia que a menudo se justifica como respuesta lamentable pero necesaria a acciones militares o terroristas agresivas. La reconciliaciÃ³n y la resiliencia nos permiten perdonar y pedir perdÃ³n, amar y estar en paz con nosotros mismos y con los demÃ¡s, incluso con quienes nos han hecho daÃ±o\", seÃ±ala el prefecto del Dicasterio, el cardenal espaÃ±ol Miguel Ãngel Ayuso Guixot. En la misiva, cita a Desmond Tutu, Buda y San Pablo VI y pide a cristianos y budistas que promuevan \"la paz, la reconciliaciÃ³n y la resiliencia\" que son \"valores profundamente arraigados\" en las respectivas tradiciones religiosas. El prefecto espaÃ±ol recoge asÃ­ el discurso de Pablo VI ante las Naciones Unidas el 4 de octubre de 1965 en el que condenÃ³ la destrucciÃ³n causada por las guerras en todo el mundo y lamenta que continÃºe la \"escalada de conflictos\" en todo el mundo lo que exige, a su juicio, una atenciÃ³n renovada a la cuestiÃ³n crÃ­tica de la paz y una reflexiÃ³n mÃ¡s profunda sobre el papel de ambas religiones en la superaciÃ³n de los obstÃ¡culos a su crecimiento. AsÃ­, insta a budistas y cristianos a hacer lo posible para poner fin al odio y al deseo de venganza que conducen a la guerra y para curar las heridas que la guerra ha infligido a la humanidad y a la Tierra. \"Si no se abordan adecuadamente las causas profundas de los conflictos y la violencia, el amanecer de una paz duradera es una ilusiÃ³n, pues no puede haber paz y reconciliaciÃ³n sin equidad y justicia en la vida polÃ­tica, econÃ³mica y cultural\", aÃ±ade. Ayuso Guixot tambiÃ©n apunta que el perdÃ³n y la reconciliaciÃ³n no consisten en fingir que las cosas son diferentes de como son. \"No se trata de darnos palmaditas en la espalda y hacer la vista gorda ante el mal. La verdadera reconciliaciÃ³n pone al descubierto el horror, el abuso, el dolor, la degradaciÃ³n, la verdad\", destaca.

author: Ricky Scaparo
title: Nevada struck by 5.6 magnitude earthquake rattling homes in California
text:
A 5.6 magnitude earthquake that struck Nevada on Monday afternoon was strong enough to rattle homes in California.
The earthquake hit 15 miles outside Yerington, about 40 miles east of Carson City, around 3 p.m. More than 10,000 people reported feeling the shaking. and two hours after the initial quake, officials reported that fourteen aftershocks had hit the region, according to USA Today.
The aftershocks ranged in size from 2.5 to 4.2. in magnitude. Residents in Carson City and Reno reported seeing light to moderate shaking, the outlet reported. Meanwhile, strong to very strong shaking was felt near the earthquakeâ€™s epicenter.
The shaking managed to travel all the way to northern California, where residents in Sacramento reported seeing household objects, including Christmas tree ornaments and a computer, swaying, according to the Los Angeles Times. There have been no reported injuries or damages.
Last week, a 7.0 magnitude earthquake hit California close to Petrolia, a town roughly 265 miles north of San Francisco. The quake, which struck at 10:40 a.m., resulted in 39 aftershocks and a tsunami warning from southern Oregon to San Francisco. At least 13 of the aftershocks ranged from 5.1 to 3.1 in magnitude. The remainder had a magnitude of at least 2.5.

author: AFP
title: Israel bombs Gaza as UN warns civilians face 'grave peril' | Jordan Times
text:
GAZA STRIP, Palestinian Territories â€” Israeli forces on Thursday heavily bombed the besieged Gaza Strip as the centre of intensified bombardment moves steadily south, where hundreds of thousands of displaced Palestinians are sheltering.
The war, which started with Hamas's October 7 sudden attack on Israel, has devastated much of northern Gaza as air and artillery strikes and house-to-house fighting have become heaviest in the southern city of Khan Yunis.
The health ministry in Hamas-run Gaza reported at least 50 deaths and dozens more wounded in strikes across the territory on Thursday morning, after an AFP correspondent reported heavy artillery strikes overnight particularly on Khan Yunis.
More than 80 per cent's of Gaza's 2.4 million people have been driven from their homes, the UN says, and many now live in cramped shelters or makeshift tents in the far south, in and around the city of Rafah near Egypt.
UN World Health Organisation chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus called for â€œurgent steps to alleviate the grave perilâ€ facing Gazaâ€™s people, including â€œterrible injuries, acute hunger and... severe risk of diseaseâ€.
French President Emmanuel Macron in a call with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu voiced his â€œdeepest concern at the very heavy civilian tollâ€ and stressed â€œthe need to work towards a lasting ceasefireâ€, Macronâ€™s office said.
Israelâ€™s relentless aerial bombardment and ground invasion with troops and tanks have killed at least 21,110 people, mostly women and children, according to Gazaâ€™s health ministry.
An Israeli siege imposed in the wake of the October 7 attack, following years of crippling blockade, has deprived Gazans of food, water, fuel and medicine.
The severe shortages have only been sporadically eased by humanitarian aid convoys entering primarly via Egypt.
â€œWe are tired of everything,â€ said Ekhlas Shnenou who fled her Gaza City home. â€œEnough with the war, enough with the pain, enough with the hunger.â€
One of the many people displaced, 28-year-old Iman Al Masry, recently gave birth to quadruplets in a hospital in southern Gaza after fleeing her familyâ€™s home in the devastated north.
The arduous journey â€œaffected my pregnancyâ€, she said, recounting that she gave birth by C-section on December 18 to two girls and two boys, one of whom was too fragile to leave hospital.
â€œThey are very slim,â€ she said of the three other infants, speaking in a cramped schoolroom turned shelter in Deir Al Balah. â€œItâ€™s cold and windy and thereâ€™s no bathtub... I just use wipes.â€
The Palestinian Red Crescent society reported fresh shelling Thursday near Al Amal hospital in Khan Yunis, killing at least 10 people.
It decried in a statement the â€œintensificationâ€ of Israeli strikes in the area of the facility, already hit earlier this week, where about 14,000 Palestinians are sheltering.

author: HÃ©ctor Huergo
title: Expoagro muestra la transiciÃ³n hacia una nueva agricultura
text:
Lo que se ve en Expoagro es la avanzada de la transiciÃ³n hacia una nueva agricultura. La Argentina, crÃ©ase o no, lidera una profunda revoluciÃ³n tecnolÃ³gica, enmarcada en dos pilares: la necesidad de incrementar la eficiencia econÃ³mica, sin que esto implique incurrir en â€œexternalidadesâ€ negativas como el impacto ambiental.
La vieja Europa inventÃ³ el arado, herramienta primigenia para â€œprepararâ€ la tierra y dejarla en condiciones de sembrar. Con los aÃ±os, el arado y otras herramientas de roturaciÃ³n terminaron destrozando los suelos en todo el mundo, eliminando la materia orgÃ¡nica, base de su vida interior. Los suelos sin materia orgÃ¡nica se hicieron mÃ¡s pesados, con menor infiltraciÃ³n del agua de lluvia, y cada vez mÃ¡s inertes.
Consecuencia: mayor costo para obtener una unidad de producto, mayor necesidad de potencia y consumo de energÃ­a. AcÃ¡ se siguiÃ³ ese modelo hasta hace cuarenta aÃ±os. Fue cuando un grupo de pioneros empezÃ³ con la siembra directa. Una agricultura â€œmÃ¡s livianaâ€, porque ya no hacia falta tanto fierro dando vueltas por el campo.
En Expoagro, no se ve un solo arado. En los salones de maquinaria europeos todavÃ­a ocupan la mitad de la superficie. AquÃ­ sÃ³lo hay sembradoras y alguno que otro implemento complementario. Las principales empresas del rubro tienen stands imponentes. Y todas vienen invirtiendo en ampliaciÃ³n de plantas.
Hace un par de aÃ±os Crucianelli, de Armstrong, levantÃ³ una empresa de agropartes que se provee a sÃ­ misma y a otras del rubro. Lo mismo Apache, de Las Parejas, ahora con una nueva nave de 3.500 metros cuadrados, con lo que ya tiene tres manzanas techadas.
Agrometal de Monte MaÃ­z no se queda atrÃ¡s. Erca, tambiÃ©n de Armstrong, estÃ¡ al momento en que escribo estas lÃ­neas celebrando la muestra con cientos de invitados en su ya emblemÃ¡tica fiesta. Todas ellas exportan y cada vez mÃ¡s. Crucianelli abriÃ³ nada menos que el mercado bÃºlgaro: Europa Oriental ya la estÃ¡ viendo.
Otro rubro que se inscribe en esto de la agricultura liviana es el del silobolsa. El silobolsa no es para â€œespecularâ€ reteniendo los granos. Es una soluciÃ³n logÃ­stica que se ha convertido en una poderosa ventaja competitiva. Hace treinta aÃ±os, cuando cosechÃ¡bamos 40 millones de toneladas, la capacidad de acopio era insuficiente y muchas toneladas quedaban en el piso. Ahora cosechamos 150 millones de toneladas y gracias al silobolsa nada queda a la intemperie. Pero lo mÃ¡s interesante es todo lo que ocurriÃ³ en torno a este sistema.
La bolsa requiere una embolsadora. Hoy hay firmas de primera lÃ­nea (Akron, Mainero, Richiger, M&S, siguen las firmas). Lleno de patentes argentinas. El mundo inundado de embolsadoras argentinas, y tambiÃ©n de extractoras porque al grano despuÃ©s hay que sacarlo y cargarlo a barco o camiÃ³n.
En este camino, la lÃ­der local de silobolsas (Ipesa) se convirtiÃ³ en la mayor consumidora de polietileno de la Argentina. En setiembre prÃ³ximo inaugura una ampliaciÃ³n de su planta en Rio Grande (Tierra del Fuego). Interesante periplo: el polietileno se elabora en el polo petroquÃ­mico de BahÃ­a Blanca (Dow). De allÃ­ viaja a Tierra del Fuego, donde una impresionante cadena de extrusoras lo convierte en las gigantescas mangas, que luego deben ser plegadas con mÃ¡quinas que inventÃ³ el mÃ­tico ZacarÃ­as Klas, que a los 90 aÃ±os sigue orientando a sus hijos en el desarrollo de la empresa.
DecÃ­amos que el polietileno se elabora en BahÃ­a Blanca. La materia prima es el gas. AsÃ­ que Vaca Muerta se convierte en grumo, el grumo en silobolsa, y Ã©ste se consume en un primer uso (luego se recicla). En consecuencia, el bolsÃ³n es un insumo de la cadena granaria. Lo que significa que, al final del dÃ­a, el maÃ­z le agregÃ³ valor al gas de Vaca Muerta. En el camino, miles de puestos de trabajo, y ademÃ¡s ingreso de divisas por las ventas a mÃ¡s de cincuenta paÃ­ses que adoptaron el sistema.
Pero hay mÃ¡s noticias. El sistema de bolsas dio lugar a negocios financieros muy sofisticados. En Expoagro estÃ¡ Nera, la plataforma de Fintech que hoy vincula a dos bancos privados muy importantes en el sector agropecuario: el Galicia y el Santander. Nera estÃ¡ dando crÃ©ditos y usa como garantÃ­a los granos embolsados, para lo que se apoya en la tecnologÃ­a se â€œSilo Realâ€, un emprendimiento AgTech que le encontrÃ³ la vuelta apoyÃ¡ndose en sistemas de monitoreo basados en algoritmos de inteligencia artificial.
Es decir, el mundo de la tecnologÃ­a digital estÃ¡ omnipresente en todas las tareas del campo. Desde las sembradoras, pulverizadoras (ahora se suman los drones) y cosechadoras, hasta las herramientas financieras tranqueras afuera. Un espectÃ¡culo conmovedor.
Expoagro subraya con notables trazos de evidencias lo que ocurre en aquella Argentina que se regodea en el pasado.
Sobre la firma
Newsletter ClarÃ­n
RecibÃ­ en tu email todas las noticias, coberturas, historias y anÃ¡lisis de la mano de nuestros periodistas especializados
QUIERO RECIBIRLO

author: @PFN365
title: Denver Broncos Playoff Scenarios and Chances: Can They Still Win the AFC West?
text: The [Denver Broncos](https://www.profootballnetwork.com/tag/denver-broncos)â€˜ playoff chances and potential scenarios took a huge hit last week with their Sunday Night Football loss. With the Kansas City Chiefs losing the next day, the Broncos must be kicking themselves for not being in a better position entering Week 17. The Broncos now need to be perfect in the next two weeks to have any chance of making the playoffs. With the help of the free PFN [NFL Playoff Predictor](https://www.profootballnetwork.com/nfl-playoff-predictor-cta-splash/), letâ€™s examine the Broncosâ€™ playoff scenarios entering Week 17 and what they need to do either win the division or secure an AFC Wild Card spot. What Are the Denver Broncosâ€™ Playoff Chances and Scenarios Entering Week 17? Simulations of the PFN Playoff Predictor give the Broncos a less than 10% chance of making the playoffs this season. Around 3% of the simulations had them winning the division, with around a further five percent having them making the postseason in a Wild Card berth. In terms of the division, the equation is simple: be perfect and hope the Chiefs continue to fall over themselves. With two weeks left to play, the Broncos are two games behind the Chiefs, so they need the maximum swing possible to win the division. The positive outlook on it for the Broncos is that if they go 2-0 and the Chiefs go 0-2, they are division champions regardless of any other results. Denver would eliminate the Las Vegas Raiders from the division potential in Week 18 with a win. Denver would then have a superior division record to the Chiefs and take the crown. Even when we look at the Wild Card picture, the Broncos have to be perfect and hope for help. A loss this week would eliminate them from contention, but there are also combinations where even if Denver wins, they are eliminated from the playoffs. The problem for the Broncos is that the Cleveland Browns have already [clinched](https://www.profootballnetwork.com/nfl-playoff-clinching-scenarios-week-17-2023/) one of the three Wild Card spots, and the Bills would put themselves out of reach for the second spot with 9.5 or 10 wins if they win or tie this week. MORE: [Denver Broncos Depth Chart](https://www.profootballnetwork.com/nfl/teams/denver-broncos/depth-chart) That would leave just one spot available for the Broncos, and they have some [NFL playoff tiebreakers](https://www.profootballnetwork.com/nfl-playoff-tiebreakers/) they cannot overcome. The Broncos have [lost to the Houston Texans](https://www.pro-football-reference.com/boxscores/202312030htx.htm), so in a two-way tiebreaker, Houston would be assured of finishing above them. A win for Pittsburgh would give them an unassailable lead in tiebreakers down to Strength of Victory, locking the Broncos out of another spot. Here are the full elimination scenarios for the Broncos this week: - Denver loses - Denver tie + Jacksonville win or tie - Denver tie + Indianapolis win or tie + Houston win or tie - Denver tie + Pittsburgh win or tie - Denver tie + Cincinnati win - Kansas City win or tie + Buffalo win or tie + Pittsburgh win - Kansas City win or tie + Buffalo win or tie + Houston win + Indianapolis win + Jacksonville lose or tie - Kansas City win or tie + Houston win + Indianapolis win + Jacksonville lose or tie + Pittsburgh win At this stage, all Denver can really do is try to go 2-0 and hope the cards fall nicely for them. Entering Week 18, there will be a much clearer picture of the Broncosâ€™ potential playoff scenarios in the AFC Wild Card picture. Want to predict the rest of the 2023 season with our FREE [NFL Playoff Predictor](https://www.profootballnetwork.com/nfl-playoff-predictor)? Looking for the most up-to-date [NFL standings](https://www.profootballnetwork.com/nfl/standings)? What about a breakdown of [team depth charts](https://www.profootballnetwork.com/nfl/depth-chart) or the [NFL schedule](https://www.profootballnetwork.com/nfl/schedule)? Pro Football Network has you covered with that and more! Listen to the PFN Fantasy Podcast Listen to the PFN Fantasy Podcast! Click the embedded player below to listen, or you can find the PFN Fantasy Podcast on [iTunes](https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/the-pfn-fantasy-football-podcast/id1609861738), [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/show/329wb1tUNaHBGBPZ2nIRV3?si=549216f0f5944a57&nd=1), and all major podcast platforms. Be sure to subscribe and leave us a five-star review! Rather watch instead? Check out the [PFN Fantasy Podcast on our Fantasy YouTube channel.](https://www.youtube.com/@pfnfantasy)

author: Connor Jones
title: Security pros baited with fake Windows LDAP exploit traps
text:
Tricky attackers trying yet again to deceive the good guys on home territory Security researchers are once again being lured into traps by attackers, this time with fake exploits of serious Microsoft security flaws.
Trend Micro spotted what appears to be a fork of the legitimate proof-of-concept (PoC) exploit for LDAPNightmare, initially published by SafeBreach Labs on January 1. But the "forked" exploit PoC actually leads to the download and execution of information-stealing malware.
LDAPNightmare is the name of the PoC for CVE-2024-49113, a 7.5-severity denial-of-service bug in LDAP patched in Microsoft's December Patch Tuesday.
It was one of two LDAP bugs â€“ the other being the critical CVE-2024-49112 â€“ addressed in Microsoft's final updates of 2024. Trend Micro researcher Sarah Pearl Camiling said that "both vulnerabilities were deemed as highly significant due to the widespread use of LDAP in Windows environments," and thus of keen interest to defenders.
In the counterfeit PoC, the legitimate version's Python files were replaced with an executable called "poc.exe." If a user ran this, it would instead drop a PowerShell script, which then downloaded and executed another script from Pastebin, collecting various data points from the user.
The stolen dataâ€¦
Connor Jones
topics: Science and Technology->information technology and computer science
